meanings.definition: Existing or occurring before something else
meanings.sent1: The ancient ruins are evidence of a preexistent civilization.
meanings.sent2: The preexistent trees provided shade for the new park.
meanings.sent3: The preexistent cookies mysteriously disappeared before the party.
meanings.sent4: Her preexistent knowledge of the subject impressed the teacher.
meanings.sent5: The preexistent stars twinkled in the night sky.

meanings.definition: Already in existence before something else
meanings.sent1: The preexistent building was renovated to preserve its history.
meanings.sent2: The preexistent rules were followed to maintain order.
meanings.sent3: The preexistent cat stole the show at the pet competition.
meanings.sent4: His preexistent reputation as a leader helped him win the election.
meanings.sent5: The preexistent melody played softly in the background.
